title: Multiplication
text: Remember that fg is the same as $$f g x$$. All we have to do is use foil to multiply the two functions.
speech: Remember that fg is the same as  f g x, . All we have to do is use foil to multiply the two functions.

. All we have to do is use foil to multiply the two functions.

title: Multiplication
text: Since we are multiplying fractions, we muliply the numerators together and the denominators together. $$1\times1=1$$, so the numerator stays the same. The denominator becomes $$(x-4)(6-x)$$ which we can leave in this factored form. Our answer is $$\frac{1}{\left(x-4\right) \left(6-x\right)}$$.
speech: Since we are multiplying fractions, we muliply the numerators together and the denominators together.  1 times 1, is equal to 1 , so the numerator stays the same. The denominator becomes  parentheses x minus 4,  times, parentheses 6 minus x,   which we can leave in this factored form. Our answer is  fraction, 1 over, parentheses x minus 4,  times, parentheses 6 minus x, ,  .
